text: once upon a time there lived a Brahmin
and his wife she gave birth to a male
child at the same time a mongoose
delivered its younger one and died the
Brahmin took pity on the Mongoose and
brought it home his wife said I will
bring up this Mongoose along with my son
very carefully and affectionately she
was very affectionate towards her son
and the Mongoose she knows that the
Mongoose is a wild animal which has got
sharp teeth
so to safeguard her son from the
Mongoose she never used to leave her son
alone with the Mongoose and go out one
day she told her husband I am going to
the river to get water the child is
alone at home so please take care of him
and left for the river
after some time the Brahman left the
house and went to beg for food from
others so the child was alone with the
mangoes in the house suddenly a black
snake came inside the house and went
near the cradle in which the child was
sleeping when the Mongoose saw the snake
it realized that the snake is its
natural enemy
the Mongoose wanted to save the child
from the snake so it's punished on the
snake and cut it into pieces then it
went out in search of the Brahmans wife
to show its bravery when she saw the
mangoes with blood around its mouth
she was tensed she was frightened and
said what an ungrateful animal you have
killed my son and she threw the pot full
of water or the Mongoose head and killed
it on the spot then she ran inside the
house and she was shocked to see that
her son was sleeping peacefully in the
cradle when the black snake was lying
dead near the cradle cut into pieces she
understood what had taken place the
Mongoose killed the snake to save her
son the blood stains on the mouth of the
Mongoose were the blood of the snake
before realizing the truth she has
killed the Mongoose she felt guilty and
repented for her action after some time
the Brahman returned home and came to
know what had happened he's called his
wife for killing the Mongoose and
necessary Martin never out tasted me
before you're out
you
